connector.description: Schedule sending of messages using the Quartz 2.x scheduler.

camel.source.path.groupName.name: camel.source.path.groupName
camel.source.path.groupName.description: The quartz group name to use. The combination of group name and trigger name should be unique.

camel.source.path.triggerName.name: camel.source.path.triggerName
camel.source.path.triggerName.description: The quartz trigger name to use. The combination of group name and trigger name should be unique.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.cron.name: camel.source.endpoint.cron
camel.source.endpoint.cron.description: Specifies a cron expression to define when to trigger.

camel.source.endpoint.deleteJob.name: camel.source.endpoint.deleteJob
camel.source.endpoint.deleteJob.description: If set to true, then the trigger automatically delete when route stop. Else if set to false, it will remain in scheduler. When set to false, it will also mean user may reuse pre-configured trigger with camel Uri. Just ensure the names match. Notice you cannot have both deleteJob and pauseJob set to true.

camel.source.endpoint.durableJob.name: camel.source.endpoint.durableJob
camel.source.endpoint.durableJob.description: Whether or not the job should remain stored after it is orphaned (no triggers point to it).

camel.source.endpoint.pauseJob.name: camel.source.endpoint.pauseJob
camel.source.endpoint.pauseJob.description: If set to true, then the trigger automatically pauses when route stop. Else if set to false, it will remain in scheduler. When set to false, it will also mean user may reuse pre-configured trigger with camel Uri. Just ensure the names match. Notice you cannot have both deleteJob and pauseJob set to true.

camel.source.endpoint.recoverableJob.name: camel.source.endpoint.recoverableJob
camel.source.endpoint.recoverableJob.description: Instructs the scheduler whether or not the job should be re-executed if a 'recovery' or 'fail-over' situation is encountered.

camel.source.endpoint.stateful.name: camel.source.endpoint.stateful
camel.source.endpoint.stateful.description: Uses a Quartz PersistJobDataAfterExecution and DisallowConcurrentExecution instead of the default job.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.customCalendar.name: camel.source.endpoint.customCalendar
camel.source.endpoint.customCalendar.description: Specifies a custom calendar to avoid specific range of date

camel.source.endpoint.jobParameters.name: camel.source.endpoint.jobParameters
camel.source.endpoint.jobParameters.description: To configure additional options on the job.

camel.source.endpoint.prefixJobNameWithE.name: camel.source.endpoint.prefixJobNameWithEndpointId
camel.source.endpoint.prefixJobNameWithE.description: Whether the job name should be prefixed with endpoint id

camel.source.endpoint.triggerParameters.name: camel.source.endpoint.triggerParameters
camel.source.endpoint.triggerParameters.description: To configure additional options on the trigger.

camel.source.endpoint.usingFixedCamelCon.name: camel.source.endpoint.usingFixedCamelContextName
camel.source.endpoint.usingFixedCamelCon.description: If it is true, JobDataMap uses the CamelContext name directly to reference the CamelContext, if it is false, JobDataMap uses use the CamelContext management name which could be changed during the deploy time.

camel.source.endpoint.autoStartScheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.autoStartScheduler
camel.source.endpoint.autoStartScheduler.description: Whether or not the scheduler should be auto started.

camel.source.endpoint.fireNow.name: camel.source.endpoint.fireNow
camel.source.endpoint.fireNow.description: If it is true will fire the trigger when the route is start when using SimpleTrigger.

camel.source.endpoint.startDelayedSecond.name: camel.source.endpoint.startDelayedSeconds
camel.source.endpoint.startDelayedSecond.description: Seconds to wait before starting the quartz scheduler.

camel.source.endpoint.triggerStartDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.triggerStartDelay
camel.source.endpoint.triggerStartDelay.description: In case of scheduler has already started, we want the trigger start slightly after current time to ensure endpoint is fully started before the job kicks in.

camel.component.quartz.bridgeErrorHandle.name: camel.component.quartz.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.quartz.bridgeErrorHandle.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.quartz.enableJmx.name: camel.component.quartz.enableJmx
camel.component.quartz.enableJmx.description: Whether to enable Quartz JMX which allows to manage the Quartz scheduler from JMX. This options is default true

camel.component.quartz.prefixInstanceNam.name: camel.component.quartz.prefixInstanceName
camel.component.quartz.prefixInstanceNam.description: Whether to prefix the Quartz Scheduler instance name with the CamelContext name. This is enabled by default, to let each CamelContext use its own Quartz scheduler instance by default. You can set this option to false to reuse Quartz scheduler instances between multiple CamelContext's.

camel.component.quartz.prefixJobNameWith.name: camel.component.quartz.prefixJobNameWithEndpointId
camel.component.quartz.prefixJobNameWith.description: Whether to prefix the quartz job with the endpoint id. This option is default false.

camel.component.quartz.properties.name: camel.component.quartz.properties
camel.component.quartz.properties.description: Properties to configure the Quartz scheduler.

camel.component.quartz.propertiesFile.name: camel.component.quartz.propertiesFile
camel.component.quartz.propertiesFile.description: File name of the properties to load from the classpath

camel.component.quartz.propertiesRef.name: camel.component.quartz.propertiesRef
camel.component.quartz.propertiesRef.description: References to an existing Properties or Map to lookup in the registry to use for configuring quartz.

camel.component.quartz.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.quartz.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.quartz.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.quartz.scheduler.name: camel.component.quartz.scheduler
camel.component.quartz.scheduler.description: To use the custom configured Quartz scheduler, instead of creating a new Scheduler.

camel.component.quartz.schedulerFactory.name: camel.component.quartz.schedulerFactory
camel.component.quartz.schedulerFactory.description: To use the custom SchedulerFactory which is used to create the Scheduler.

camel.component.quartz.autoStartSchedule.name: camel.component.quartz.autoStartScheduler
camel.component.quartz.autoStartSchedule.description: Whether or not the scheduler should be auto started. This options is default true

camel.component.quartz.interruptJobsOnSh.name: camel.component.quartz.interruptJobsOnShutdown
camel.component.quartz.interruptJobsOnSh.description: Whether to interrupt jobs on shutdown which forces the scheduler to shutdown quicker and attempt to interrupt any running jobs. If this is enabled then any running jobs can fail due to being interrupted.

camel.component.quartz.startDelayedSecon.name: camel.component.quartz.startDelayedSeconds
camel.component.quartz.startDelayedSecon.description: Seconds to wait before starting the quartz scheduler.
